<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2016670/88035509-da758080-cb74-11ea-87ac-e010e3289c57.png></denchmark-link>
The path variable is reserved in zsh, which is bind with PATH, so the path should not be used as a common variable in the script. Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS): <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Please provide a script that can be run to reproduce the issue. The script should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments): If we cannot run your script, we cannot fix your issue.
I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue. I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.

comments.comment: Thanks for reporting. I'll change it, but I don't believe we actually support zsh yet; these are meant to be Bash scriptsâ€”there are a number of incompatibilities (like brackets) that we've never accounted for. So you should try to use Bash if possible regardless. Actually, <denchmark-link:https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/general.html#genrule>Bazel is supposed to call Bash</denchmark-link> , so this seems more like a Bazel bug.

Bazel is supposed to call Bash
My OS is macOS Catalina which make zsh as a default shell tool. So I think it will block many developers.
